intro: Hypolytrum unispicatum, commonly known as the single-spurred hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale green flowers. It is often found in open grasslands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
